book.title: Sonnets from the Portuguese
book.author: Browning, Elizabeth Barrett
book.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese

chapter.title: I. I thought once how Theocritus had sung
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/1.xml

chapter.title: II. But only three in all God's universe
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/2.xml

chapter.title: III. Unlike are we, unlike, O princely Heart!
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/3.xml

chapter.title: IV. Thou hast thy calling to some palace-floor
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/4.xml

chapter.title: V. I lift my heavy heart up solemnly
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/5.xml

chapter.title: VI. Go from me. Yet I feel that I shall stand
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/6.xml

chapter.title: VII. The face of all the world is changed, I think
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/7.xml

chapter.title: VIII. What can I give thee back, O liberal
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/8.xml

chapter.title: IX. Can it be right to give what I can give?
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/9.xml

chapter.title: X. Yet, love, mere love, is beautiful indeed
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/10.xml

chapter.title: XI. And therefore if to love can be desert
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/11.xml

chapter.title: XII. Indeed this very love which is my boast
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/12.xml

chapter.title: XIII. And wilt thou have me fashion into speech
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/13.xml

chapter.title: XIV. If thou must love me, let it be for nought
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/14.xml

chapter.title: XV. Accuse me not, beseech thee, that I wear
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/15.xml

chapter.title: XVI. And yet, because thou overcomest so
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/16.xml

chapter.title: XVII. My poet, thou canst touch on all the notes
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/17.xml

chapter.title: XVIII. I never gave a lock of hair away
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/18.xml

chapter.title: XIX. The soul's Rialto hath its merchandize
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/19.xml

chapter.title: XX. Beloved, my Beloved, when I think
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/20.xml

chapter.title: XXI. Say over again, and yet once over again
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/21.xml

chapter.title: XXII. When our two souls stand up erect and strong
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/22.xml

chapter.title: XXIII. Is it indeed so? If I lay here dead
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/23.xml

chapter.title: XXIV. Let the world's sharpness like a clasping knife
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/24.xml

chapter.title: XXV. A heavy heart, Beloved, have I borne
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/25.xml

chapter.title: XXVI. I lived with visions for my company
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/26.xml

chapter.title: XXVII. My own Beloved, who hast lifted me
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/27.xml

chapter.title: XXVIII. My letters! all dead paper, mute and white!
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/28.xml

chapter.title: XXIX. I think of thee!--my thoughts do twine and bud
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/29.xml

chapter.title: XXX. I see thine image through my tears to-night
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/30.xml

chapter.title: XXXI. Thou comest! all is said without a word
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/31.xml

chapter.title: XXXII. The first time that the sun rose on thine oath
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/32.xml

chapter.title: XXXIII. Yes, call me by my pet-name! let me hear
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/33.xml

chapter.title: XXXIV. With the same heart, I said, I'll answer thee
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/34.xml

chapter.title: XXXV. If I leave all for thee, wilt thou exchange
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/35.xml

chapter.title: XXXVI. When we met first and loved, I did not build
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/36.xml

chapter.title: XXXVII. Pardon, oh, pardon, that my soul should make
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/37.xml

chapter.title: XXXVIII. First time he kissed me, he but only kissed
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/38.xml

chapter.title: XXXIX. Because thou hast the power and own'st the grace
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/39.xml

chapter.title: XL. Oh, yes! they love through all this world of ours!
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/40.xml

chapter.title: XLI. I thank all who have loved me in their hearts
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/41.xml

chapter.title: XLII. My future will not copy fair my past
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/42.xml

chapter.title: XLIII. How do I love thee? Let me count the ways
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/43.xml

chapter.title: XLIV. Beloved, thou hast brought me many flowers
chapter.location: B/Elizabeth Barrett Browning/Sonnets from the Portuguese/44.xml
